intro: Aeollanthus myrianthus subsp. gamwelliae, commonly known as the Gamwell’s hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a soft, hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
